body_html:
With version <1.3.0 I was able to load using the following

sys.path.insert(0, r'lib\tensorflow_gpu_130')
sys.path.append('lib')
os.environ['PATH']=r'lib\tensorflow_gpu_130;'+os.environ['PATH']
import tensorflow as tf
print(tf.version)

Version 1.3.0 and later this scheme no longer works, the approach to find the mname value in pywrap_tensorflow_internal.py appears to be the same, Reviewing now.

body:
With version <1.3.0 I was able to load using the following

sys.path.insert(0, r'lib\tensorflow_gpu_130')
sys.path.append('lib')
os.environ['PATH']=r'lib\tensorflow_gpu_130;'+os.environ['PATH']
import tensorflow as tf
print(tf.__version__)

Version 1.3.0 and later this scheme no longer works, the approach to find the mname value in pywrap_tensorflow_internal.py appears to be the same, Reviewing now.
